title: Who is Humble and Meek? | HDG Srila Prabhupada | Bg 1.43 | 22.07.2024
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

segments.text: Reading from Srimad Bhagavad Gita, Chapter 1
Observing the Armies on the Battlefield of Rootsetra
Translation in purport by His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Srila Prabhupada
O Trishna, maintainer of the people,
I have heard by disciplined succession that
Parpat by His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Srila Prabhupada
not on his own personal experience
but on what he has heard from the authorities
that is the way of receiving real knowledge.
One cannot reach the real point of factual knowledge
without being helped by the right person.
One who is already established in that knowledge.
There is a system in the Varanastrama institution
by which one has to undergo the process of ablation
before death for his sinful activities.
One who is always engaged in sinful activities
must utilize the process of ablation,
Without doing so, one surely will be transferred to the right path.
One who is engaged in sinful activities
will not be transferred to the left path.
One who has been engaged in sinful activities
should be transferred to hellish planets
in order to undergo a miserable life
as a result of sinful activities.
O Krishna, maintainer of the people,
I have heard by disciplined succession
that those who destroy family traditions
So family tradition, whose family tradition? Manuśyāna. Family, Manuśyāna, those who are human beings, they have got family and family rituals,
kula-dharma, jāti-dharma, just like cātur-varnu-maya system, guna-karma-vipāda. This is meant for the human being, Manuśyāna, not for the animals.
So unless the human society accepts that,
these principles of varnasana-dharma, ordained by Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Lord,
is not considered amongst the human beings. They are as good as animals, because there is no regular, systematic principles.
of how to live a human being.
Therefore in the Viṣṇu Purāṇa, when Caitanya Mahāprabhu was talking with Rāmānanda Rāya,
so Caitanya Mahāprabhu inquired, what is the actual aim of life?
Sādhya-sādhana. Sādhya and sādhana. What is the aim?
Sādhya means what for this human form of life we have got. That is called sādhya, the goal, the goal of life.
the activity by which we can attain, we can achieve that goal of life.
The Darwin theory, although they are given some idea of progressive evolution,
but he does not know what is the goal of life, why this progress is there.
That these rascals, they do not know.
Taking some hints from the Padma Purāṇa, Brahma Vaibhata Purāṇa.
Asyadeṁ saturāṁ caiva lakkhāṁ stāṁ jīva-jātiṣu.
the living entity is wandering in the cycle of transmigration of the soul.
So from this, Mr. Darwin might have taken some hints,
but he could not explain properly.
He could not catch up that Brahmadvī, who is wandering.
why this living entity is wandering,
So there must be some goal.
There must be some goal of life.
To achieve that goal of life,
So this question was raised by Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
What is the goal of life?
Unless there is goal of life,
There must be some goal of life,
śādhana means the means by which
we can achieve that goal of life.
that he is a nonsense number one.
What is the value of his opinion?
But this is the Vedic principle.
because sannyāsī is supposed to be
it was known to Prakāśananda Sarasvati
I am lower than the worm
one has become very big man,
and he has his own opinion to give.

if it is done like that,
then people will go to hell.

what is the aim of life?
he did not give his own opinion.
So if this is the system
now happening. Utsarna, all destroyed, finished. Kula-dharmana, no family life. Therefore,
for human being, it is the duty to understand his position, and it is his duty to satisfy
the Supreme Lord, Vishnu. This is the whole plan. Therefore, Ramananda Raya quoted the
verse from Vishnu Purana. The varnasrama-carvatam purujena para-pramana. Vishnu-aradhati. Because
the aim is to satisfy Vishnu, to become Vaisnava. To become Brahmana is also to satisfy the
lower status. You will hear from the Caitanya-caritamrta that our Madhavendra Puri, he was installing
deities. So there are many Brahmanas, caste Brahmana born in. So in order to give charge
of worship to those Brahmanas, he initiated them to become Vaisnavas.
Because without becoming Vaisnava, nobody has got right to worship Vishnu. Vishnu will
not accept anything from anyone unless he is devotee. And Vishnu is poverty-stricken
that he has come to take from you. He cannot eat. He has no eating means. No, he can't.
He agrees to accept our offering just on the basis of love. The Vaishnava loves Vishnu and Vishnu agrees to accept any foodstuff.
That bhakti is main thing, not your palatable dish. Vishnu is quite competent to prepare thousand times better palatable dishes than you can offer. But the real thing is bhakti.
So Vishnu Aradhana means, that should be the aim of human life.
Vishnu Aradhana means one must become a Vaishnava. And Vaishnava means regulated life.
Not destroy everything, finish, to become hoax. That is not Vaishnava. Vaishnava means regulated life. Aim to how to satisfy Vishnu.
So whole Vedic scheme is there. How to satisfy Vishnu? Therefore it is said, the ussanya-kula-dharmanam manasranam.
In the human life, if they do not follow the regulative principles of family life, family tradition and systematic arrangement of four division of the society,
In this way, we can satisfy the Supreme Lord. Our aim is to satisfy the Supreme Lord. And this can be done perfectly, if we follow the regulative principles of jati-dharma, kula-dharma.
Jati-dharma means, if you are born in the family of a Brahmana, you have got particular duties.
Simply, you have to engage in this.
duties. Simply if you think yourself that I am in, I am born in a Brahman family, my
duty is all finished. Now I can do whatever nonsense. They think like that. I have spoken.
They are very much proud of taking birth in Brahmana family. So when others are engaged
in devotional service, they say, oh, you are born in lower family. You have got to
do this. We are born in Brahmana family. We have nothing to do. But they do not know that
jati-dharma-kula-grhana, utsanna-kula-dharmana. If you are actually Brahmana, you must keep
your family tradition. That is Brahmana.
Otherwise, if you sacrifice everything of your family tradition, just like in your country,
the lower family, the lower family is maintained. The government, the lower family has got money
deposited with the government. And government gives the interest so that the family tradition
Or if they spoil, then no one cares for them. Then their house will be sold and they will
be still bigger. No more Lord family. So everywhere, you take politically or socially or spiritually.
For human beings, if you want to make your life successful, then you must keep the tradition
So our, we are Visnava. Our only tradition is how to satisfy Visnava. That is the tradition
of everyone. But especially our Visnava. They must be very alert, very careful how to keep
Lord Visnava, Krsna satisfied. That is our only business. You should not neglect it.
You should not neglect it. Then utsanna-kula-dharmana.
Then you will spoil everything. When you have invited Visnava, Krsna, Ekanya, Mahaprabhu
to accept your service, you must be very, very careful how to render service. How cleanly,
how nicely you have to serve. Otherwise everything will be spoiled.
Visnava's kula-dharma is simply to satisfy.
Visnava's kula-dharma is simply to satisfy.
Visnava's kula-dharma is simply to satisfy.
Visnava's kula-dharma is simply to satisfy.
Visnava's kula-dharma is simply to satisfy, Krsna.
So in the manuṣana, actually human life begins, when he's ready to serve the Supreme
Otherwise they are never like that.
Therefore, the whole world is in chaos.
They are not eager to have Visnu.
are simply eager to serve their senses. Godas, servant of the senses. So instead of becoming
servant of the senses, you have to become master of the senses. That is called gosvam.
If you remain servant of the senses, then you are godas. Kamadinankati dhanakati. That
is animal life. And when you become master of the senses, how it is possible? Master
of the senses. Now, if you employ your senses always in the service of Krsna, your senses
are already controlled. Just like your tongue. Your tongue asks you to go to the restaurant
and eat some nice thing. But if you are a Vaishnava, then you are not a Vaishnava. You
are not a Vaishnava. If you have this vow that I shall not allow my tongue to eat anything
except prasadam, it is already controlled. Gosvam. That means to control the senses means
to engage the senses in the service of the Lord. This is control. Otherwise, by force,
just like the yogis, they try artificially. By some force, they try artificially. But
some gymnastics. That may be possible for some time. But if it is, there are many instances,
it becomes impossible. Because by force, you cannot control the senses. That is not possible.
You must give better and just better. If I force, you think that I shall control my tongue,
I shall control my eyes, I shall control my eyes, or I shall control my belly. Artificial.
But sometimes. But they are so strong. The senses are so strong. Artificially, it can
have this power. Param drstasyam. Stated in the Bhagavad-gita. That is, give the senses
better engagement. Then you can control. Risi-kena risi-kesa sevana-dvaha sarva-pādipi-nenmukta-tattva-tena.
You have to purify the senses. How? By engaging the senses in the sarva-paratvena. In fact,
then you will be able to purify the senses. And purified senses, when you are engaged in
the service of the Supreme, that is called bhakti. So if we are actually human beings,
manushyana, pulo-dharma, this family tradition is not meant for the cats and dogs. If you
live life, cats, no question of family tradition. But if you live one life, you will be able

So it is a horrible tradition.

He, the hog that I am living, the most, and he will die.
In the human mind, hellish condition of life, then he can make progress in spiritual life.
And so long he thinks, I am living very peacefully, very happily, athāta-brahma-jitgāsa.
